options.content:
![logo image](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marinebon/mbon-dashboard-server/client-fknms/static_files/home_dash_logo.png)


### Directions for site navigation 

Locations where satellite data are extracted are shown on the map as black hatched areas.

Select a specific location using the "Satellite Time Series Extraction Locations" dropdown menu at left.

Select mean, climatology or anomaly using the "Time Series Metric" dropdown menu.

Buoy locations (red dots on map) can also be selected using the "Buoy Locations" dropdown. Scroll down to see a list of buoy locations.

The range of the displayed time period can be adjusted at top right.

### Locations of extracted satellite data:
* BIS: Offshore Biscayne Bay
* UK: Upper Keys
* M/UK: Middle/Upper Keys
* MK: Middle Keys
* LK: Lower Keys
* MQ: Marquesas
* DT: Dry Tortugas
* WFS: West Florida Shelf
* SR: Shark River
* WFB: West Florida Bay
* EFB: East Florida Bay (SST only)

### Buoy locations:
* 1: Whipray Basin
* 2: Butternut Key
* 3: Peterson Key
* 4: Bob Allen Key
* 5: Little Rabbit Key

panels.title: Welcome to the Florida Keys data dashboard

panels.description: VIIRS-SNPP 750-m chlorophyll-a concentration (mg/m^3) binned to 7-day intervals. Anomaly images are created by subtracting a 7-day climatology using data from 2013-2019.
panels.title: VIIRS-SNPP CHLa 7-Day anomaly images (mg/m^3)

panels.description: VIIRS-SNPP 750-m nighttime sea-surface temperature (DegC) binned to 7-day intervals. Anomaly images are created by subtracting a 7-day climatology using data from 2013-2019.
panels.title: VIIRS-SNPP 7-Day nighttime SST anomaly images (DegC)

panels.description: VIIRS-SNPP 750-m remote sensing reflectance (sr^-1) at 671nm binned to 7-day intervals. This is a proxy for suspended sediments at the surface. Anomaly images are created by subtracting a 7-day climatology using data from 2013-2019.
panels.title: VIIRS-SNPP remote sensing reflectance at 671nm 7-Day anomaly images (sr^-1)

panels.description: MODIS-Aqua 1km Algal Bloom Index (W/m^2/um/sr) binned to 7-day intervals. Algal Bloom Index (ABI) is based on normalized fluorescence line height and can be used to identify algal blooms. Anomaly images are created by subtracting a 7-day climatology using data from 2003-2019.
panels.title: MODIS-Aqua ABI 7-Day anomaly images (W/m^2/um/sr)

panels.description: Dynamic seascapes are classified using multivariate data and describe basin and gyre scale features and seasonal boundary shifts. A description of seascape classes can be found HERE.
panels.title: Dynamic biogeographic seascapes (class)

targets.query:
SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) as metric FROM "chlor_a"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "sstn"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "Rrs_671"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "Kd_490"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT /^$metric$/ FROM disch
WHERE (location = 'FKdb' AND $timeFilter )
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

panels.title: USGS River Discharge from rivers draining to Everglades (sum of discharge from green dots on map - m^3/sec)

targets.query:
SELECT /^$metric$/ FROM disch
WHERE (location = 'FWCdb_EFL' AND $timeFilter )
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

panels.title: USGS Gage Height from Tamiami Canal draining into Biscayne Bay (red circle on map - meters)

targets.query:
SELECT mean(sea_water_temperature)  AS "sea_water_temperature"
 FROM "salinity" WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Bouys$/) AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

panels.title: In-situ temperature at ~1m depth (psu) from selected buoy(s)

targets.query:
SELECT mean(sea_water_practical_salinity)  AS "sea_water_practical_salinity"
 FROM "salinity" WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Bouys$/) AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

panels.title: In-situ salinity (psu) at ~1m depth from selected buoy(s)

options.content:
* Satellite data is from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS-Aqua) sensor and is obtained from the [Ocean Biology Processing Group](https://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/) at NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center.

* Algal Bloom Index (ABI) is calculated using the method of Hu and Feng (2016; doi: 10.1117/1.JRS.11.012003) 

* River discharge data is obtained from the [USGS National Water Information System](https://waterdata.usgs.gov/nwis). Discharge values from the Shark, Broad, Lostmans and Chatham Rivers (green circles on map above) are summed to estimate discharge into the southern West Florida Shelf and plotted above. 

* In-situ temperature and salinity data is obtained from buoys maintained by the National Park Service and accessed through the [National Data Buoy Center](https://www.ndbc.noaa.gov/)

* Dynamic seascapes are classified using multivariate satellite data and describe basin and gyre scale features and seasonal boundary shifts. They are obtained from [NOAA's Coastwatch](https://cwcgom.aoml.noaa.gov/erddap/griddap/noaa_aoml_seascapes_8day.graph). A description of seascape classes can be found [HERE](https://shiny.marinebon.app/seascapes/classes.html).

Please feel free to contact us with questions or to sign up for email alerts:

Dr. Daniel Otis - [dotis@usf.edu](mailto:dotis@usf.edu)

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "chlor_a" WITH KEY = "location" WHERE "region" = 'GOM'
list.label: Satellite Time Series Extraction Locations
list.name: Locations
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "chlor_a" WITH KEY = "location" WHERE "region" = 'GOM'

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "salinity" WITH KEY = "location" WHERE "source" = 'NDBC'
list.label: Bouy Locations
list.name: Bouys
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "salinity" WITH KEY = "location" WHERE "source" = 'NDBC'
